sections: Were these the best cars of the ‘20s?
In 1926, Buick came out with the

, a car that uses its strikingly curvaceous body to draw attention wherever it goes. As is the case with many classic luxury brands, the idea behind Buick's founding seems to have always been about providing people with the kind of comfort that could typically only be found within their home. Without a doubt, that's something that this car does very well with a spacious interior with what looks to be an interesting cross between a bucket and bench seating. Under the hood is a straight-six powerhouse and manual transmission which also adds to the driving experience tying the whole car together quite nicely.
A little bit later in the decade,
car which may have indeed competed with the aforementioned automobile. It was called the

, likely because of its six-cylinder J block engine that made accelerating and driving at higher speeds, compared to others like it, more possible for the time. Without a doubt, these were all assets associated with only the best vehicles of the 1920s. Finally, the rumble seating and interior were pretty driver-focused which is an unexpected twist for a car like this.

Overall, the 1920s were a great time for luxury automotive manufacturers and these vehicles show that off pretty well. With all sorts of performance, luxury, and general driving-oriented innovations, they create an appeal, unlike any other vehicles on the road. So it makes sense that you’d want to get your hands on these prices of automotive art and history. The only question is if you’ll be able to before someone else does.

in the beautiful Salt Lake Valley for the 8th Annual Salt Lake City Classic Car Auction!  The towering Wasatch Mountain Range serves as an amazing backdrop for an excellent line-up of some of the region’s finest classic and collector cars selling across the auction block.  This looks to be the biggest and best classic car auction ever along the Wasatch Range!  From Muscle Cars to Vintage Rides and Street Rods to Classic Trucks, you'll see it all!
Online bidding is also available at

April is an excellent time to be in the Salt Lake region as the weather turns wonderful, outdoor recreation abounds, and classic cars emerge from their winter slumber.  The Mountain America Expo Center provides an excellent indoor venue for the Auction!  Sellers: Present your car to the local, regional and national market.  Buyers:  View, bid on and take one of these incredible cars home!  Bid live in person, by phone or by internet.
The sale location is Mountain America Expo Center 9575 State St
